thread.title: WSJ Wealth Adviser Briefing: Small Lenders, Clawbacks, Speedy Baseballs

author: WSJ Staff
title: WSJ Wealth Adviser Briefing: Small Lenders, Clawbacks, Speedy Baseballs
text: Investors seeking both high income and low taxes poured billions of dollars into publicly traded energy master limited partnerships. Now many have tax headaches—surprisingly big bills from Uncle Sam and return preparers, writes Laura Sanders. Below, some of the best analysis and insight from WSJ writers and columnists, and occasionally beyond, on investing, the wealth-management WSJ City: Italy's Drama Raises Stakes for Euro, Investors Come Home to U.S. Stocks Next Saudi Arabia to the Oil Market: Jump but Not Too High—Energy Journal
